title.rendered: Dallas TX Vent Cleaning: 5 Ways to Achieve Healthier Home Airflow

content.rendered:
Most homeowners pay a lot of attention to their home’s curb appeal or wall paint, but only a rare few ever think about the indoor air quality. With the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, you and your family might be spending more time indoors now, which means you need to change the way you think about your home’s airflow. Don’t believe us? According to the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), the air inside your home maybe 5 times more polluted than the air outdoors, even if you live in Texas! And this is why you might need to get the Dallas TX Vent Cleaning done soon.

You may already know that spending too much time in stuffy places poses serious health risks. And research shows that living in moldy and damp homes can increase the risk of respiratory ailments by as much as 40%.

We cannot stress enough the importance of fresh air on your health, sleep, mood, and even work performance. To that end, our licensed Dallas, TX duct cleaning experts have given us some tips on how to achieve healthier airflow in your home.

Say Yes to Houseplants

Certain houseplants can really eliminate toxins from the air inside your house, and also add fresh oxygen at the same time. It doesn’t hurt that they look good while doing it. Some of the best plants for improving the indoor air quality include:

  • Gerbera Daisy
  • Mass Cane
  • Bamboo Palm
  • English Ivy
  • Rubber Plant
  • Aloe Vera.

Keep the Air Ducts Clean

Over time as your heating or cooling system runs, dust, dirt, and other pollutants get accumulated in the ductwork. This buildup reduces the airflow that travels through the ducts, which leads to a reduced level of conditioned air in the room.

If you are experiencing any problems with the airflow in your home, dirty or clogged up ducts are likely to be the culprit. So, don’t delay in calling the Dallas TX vent cleaning professionals to have your ductwork evaluated.

Burn a Salt Lamp

Salt lamps are created by putting a light source inside a large heap of Himalayan salt. When you light it up, the lamp emits negative ions that fight against the positively-charged particles of pollution and contaminants in the air. If you or someone in your home suffers from respiratory issues, like asthma, a salt lamp may help reduce the symptoms.

Keep the Air Conditioner Filter Clean

Air conditioners can also help improve the air quality in your home by refreshing the stale air. If you keep the AC filter clean, it will ensure that pollen, dust, dirt, small animal parts, etc. don’t enter your indoor airflow.

Remember, air filters will only work if they are regularly cleaned out. It’s recommended to call reliable Dallas, TX duct cleaning professionals to get the filters cleaned or replaced on a regular basis.

Don’t Block the Air Registers or Vents

Sometimes, the design of a room or furniture placement can inhibit the airflow. So, make sure no decorations, draping, or furniture is blocking the registers or vents in the room. Blocked vents mean the air won’t be able to circulate fresh air the way it should.

Fresh, Clean Air is Your Right: Call Dallas TX Vent Cleaning Today

If it has been a while since your HVAC system or ductwork was thoroughly cleaned, it might be time to change that. Remember, dirty air ducts and vents are especially dangerous these days with the risk of COVID-19 hanging on everyone’s head!

Call us at 866-836-2341 or contact us online to schedule a Dallas TX vent cleaning today.
